result.execSummary:
The defendant Vieta L Caldwell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee county.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied - PAID IN FULL.  Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.  DNA sample and surcharge are waived.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the JC Penny Store listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Criminal Thinking Class.
Case 16CM194 is dismissed and read in.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vieta L Caldwell

records.addlTxt: Motion to forfeit bail granted.
Entered without missed court date. Reprinted with missed court date.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Vieta L Caldwell in court with attorney Anna M Kees.  
Court vacates the stayed warrant.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defenant Guilty of the charge.



Court orders the following:
125 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  1 Year.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Criminal Thinking Class.
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  JC Penny's listed in the criminal complaint.
DNA sample to be provided.

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives.
Apply Bail.
Balance to be refunded to the posting party.
